verses.verse: To the chief<WH5329> Musician,<WH5329> A Psalm<WH4210> of David,<WH1732> when Nathan<WH5416> the prophet<WH5030> came<WH935> unto him, after<WH834> he had gone<WH935> in to Bathsheba.<WH1339> Have mercy<WH2603> on me, O God,<WH430> according to your loving kindness:<WH2617> according to the multitude<WH7230> of your tender mercies<WH7356> blot<WH4229> out my transgressions.<WH6588>
Wash<WH3526> me thoroughly<WH7235> from my iniquity,<WH5771> and cleanse<WH5352> me from my sin.<WH2403>
For I acknowledge<WH3045> my transgressions:<WH6588> and my sin<WH2403> is ever<WH8548> before<WH5048> me.

Against you, you only,<WH905> have I sinned,<WH2398> and done<WH6213> this<WH2063> evil<WH7451> in your sight:<WH5869> that you might be justified<WH6663> when you speak,<WH1696> and be clear<WH2135> when you judge.<WH8199>
Behold,<WH2005> I was shaped<WH2342> in iniquity;<WH5771> and in sin<WH2399> did my mother<WH517> conceive<WH3179> me.
Behold,<WH2005> you desire<WH2654> truth<WH571> in the inward<WH2910> parts: and in the hidden<WH5640> part you shall make me to know<WH3045> wisdom.<WH2451>
Purge<WH2398> me with hyssop,<WH231> and I shall be clean:<WH2891> wash<WH3526> me, and I shall be whiter<WH3835> than snow.<WH7950>
Make me to hear<WH8085> joy<WH8342> and gladness;<WH8057> that the bones<WH6106> which you have broken<WH1794> may rejoice.<WH1523>
Hide<WH5641> your face<WH6440> from my sins,<WH2399> and blot<WH4229> out all<WH3605> my iniquities.<WH5771>
Create<WH1254> in me a clean<WH2889> heart,<WH3820> O God;<WH430> and renew<WH2318> a right<WH3559> spirit<WH7307> within<WH7130> me.
Cast<WH7993> me not away from your presence;<WH6440> and take<WH3947> not your holy<WH6944> spirit<WH7307> from me.
Restore<WH7725> to me the joy<WH8342> of your salvation;<WH3468> and uphold<WH5564> me with your free<WH5081> spirit.<WH7307>
Then will I teach<WH3925> transgressors<WH6586> your ways;<WH1870> and sinners<WH2400> shall be converted<WH7725> to you.
Deliver<WH5337> me from bloodguiltiness,<WH1818> O God,<WH430> you God<WH430> of my salvation:<WH8668> and my tongue<WH3956> shall sing<WH7442> aloud<WH7442> of your righteousness.<WH6666>
O Lord,<WH136> open<WH6605> you my lips;<WH8193> and my mouth<WH6310> shall show<WH5046> forth your praise.<WH8416>
For you desire<WH2654> not sacrifice;<WH2077> else would I give<WH5414> it: you delight<WH7521> not in burnt<WH5930> offering.
The sacrifices<WH2077> of God<WH430> are a broken<WH7665> spirit:<WH7307> a broken<WH7665> and a contrite<WH1794> heart,<WH3820> O God,<WH430> you will not despise.<WH959>
Do good<WH3190> in your good pleasure<WH7522> to Zion:<WH6726> build<WH1129> you the walls<WH2346> of Jerusalem.<WH3389>

Then<WH227> shall you be pleased<WH2654> with the sacrifices<WH2077> of righteousness,<WH6664> with burnt<WH5930> offering and whole<WH3632> burnt<WH5930> offering: then<WH227> shall they offer<WH5927> bullocks<WH6499> on your altar.<WH4196>
